task.title: Setting up environment variables on an UNIX System
task.shortdesc: You have to define the JAVA_HOME environment variable.

step.info: Replace [jdk-path] by the location of you JDK. For example: /usr/jdk/jdk1.6.0_14

choices.choice: Korn or bash shells: export JAVA_HOME=[jdk-path]
If you are using a Bourne shell: JAVA_HOME=[jdk-path] export JAVA_HOME
IIf you are using a C shell: set env JAVA_HOME [jdk-path]
Korn or bash shells: export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH
